p: An individual infected with ZikaV will often manifest only mild symptoms or none. The most common symptoms are fever, rash, joint pain, and conjunctivitis. Occasionally, there can be related muscle pain or headaches. ZikaV manifests itself very much like the common flu, and consequently most people do not seek medical attention when infected. Moreover, like the flu, it can last from several days up to a few weeks. An increased association with Guillain–Barré syndrome, an uncommon disease of the nervous system, has also caused concerns. Death results rarely from ZikaV infection. Be that as it may, at the end of 2016, the most distressing effect of ZikaV infection has been for mothers during pregnancy because ZikaV was associated with a brain birth defect – microcephaly. Additional complications for infants born of ZikaV-infected mothers include defects of the eyes, ears, and growth [ 16].
